Kristian,
 
Thank you for the patch. David and I had reviewing it on our list last night
but we ended up switching metaphors for the functionality formerly known as
"interceptors" instead. We will review the patch at our next session.
 
Regards,
 
Kent

  _____  

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
krosenvold
Sent: Wednesday, July 01, 2009 3:58 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Maven,spring3,aspectj and junit can now run parallel tests





A full set of patches that allows parallel running of tests in
maven/spring3/junit environment has been released.

This blogpost (http://incodewetrus <http://incodewetrustinc.blogspot.com/>
tinc.blogspot.com/) in question outlines the steps needed for parallel
running, and the expected benefits.

The patches have been submitted to the projects in question, but as of
today, they do not exist in any release. The full set of patches has been
run on a "production builf system" in a highly concurrent 2-chip 8 core xeon
server for a total of 7 days flat out without any concurrency related
issues, a total of nearly 7000 builds have been run.

I will be maintaining this patch-set until the respective projects hopefully
accept the patches. (Spring, aspectj, junit and maven-surefire)

Kristian Rosenvold, http://twitter. <http://twitter.com/krosenvold>
com/krosenvold for further updates
